newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ forest sector kicks stocks off to strong start.
newsitem.headline: NZ forest sector kicks stocks off to strong start.

text.p: * Forest sector boosts New Zealand shares at opening
* Broader market flattens, some bluechips marked down
* Volume remains light continuing trend seen this week
Price movements at 10.15 a.m. (2215 GMT)
LAST CHG * NZSE40 cap index +9.39 at 2,416.89
137 nil * NZSE-10 cap index +5.81 at 1,223.48
360 +5 * NZSC cap index -0.75 at 5,093.62
349 +5 * NZMC .NZMC cap index +0.55 at 1,897.42
371 -1 * Volume NZ$12 million. Futures untraded
737 -1 * Other movers - +10 +3
Forest sector stocks kicked the New Zealand share market off to a strong start on thin turnover while the broader market was flat, brokers said.
By 10.15 a.m. (2215 GMT) the NZSE-40 Capital Index was up 9.39 points at 2,416.89 on turnover worth NZ$12 million.
Forestry sector stocks Carter Holt Harvey, up five at NZ$3.60, Fletcher Paper, up five at $3.49 and Fletcher Forests, up 10 at $2.20, were leading the charge.
Telecom, having driven the market over the last few days, fell quiet and lost one cent to NZ$7.37.
Murray Rutherford at brokers SBC Warburg said the forest sector was simply reflecting a general re-rating as inventory levels declined and pulp prices rose.
"Most of the gains have been in those forestry-related leaders," he said.
Outside the first tier issues, Newmarket Property Trust took a five cent dive to NZ$0.72 after an announcement on Thursday that its June year profit would be materially below its original forecast.
The company forecast net profit after tax for the year to June 30 of NZ$1.857 million and $5.078 million for the June 1998 year.
-- James Gray, Auckland newsroom (64 9) 302 1253
